description: This course is intended as an introduction to the history of Chinese art, offering a survey of major artistic developments from neolithic times to the present. Among the topics to be considered: ritual bronzes; funerary remains of the Qin and Han; Buddhist sculpture; and the evolution of landscape painting. Important issues to be discussed include production and patronage, function, and borrowing and influence in the evolution of artistic works across time and space.
name: Arts of China
title: The Arts of China
